newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Man's best friend also his most dear in China.
newsitem.headline: Man's best friend also his most dear in China.

text.p: Dog owners in southern China must pay 10,000 yuan (US$1,205), two years' wages for many people, to get a dog licence, Hong Kong's Ming Pao newspaper reported on Friday.
The dog "ID cards" were introduced earlier this month in the province of Guangdong, across the border from Hong Kong, as an attempt to control a growing pet dog population, Ming Pao said.
The provincial capital Guangzhou is home to about 8,000 dogs, the newspaper said.

Pet animals, long considered unhygienic or a symbol of bourgeois society, were banned in Chinese towns until recent years. But rules have been relaxed in some cities where greater prosperity has spawned a craze for pets.
